use_cases: Track HBAR transfers and payments between accounts
Analyze transaction fees and costs for network usage
Monitor smart contract interactions and function calls
Track token transfers and exchanges (fungible and non-fungible)
Audit account activity patterns and transaction history
Generate transaction volume reports and statistics
Investigate suspicious or fraudulent transaction patterns
Monitor network congestion and transaction throughput
Analyze transaction success rates and failure patterns
Track consensus timestamp patterns and network timing
Monitor transaction types and their frequency
Analyze gas usage patterns for smart contracts
Investigate transaction routing and memo patterns
rules: CRITICAL: ALWAYS include the partition field 'created' for the selected table in the WHERE clause, adjust the date filters based on user query
CRITICAL: NEVER add date filters with INTERVAL unless user explicitly specifies a time period (like 'last 30 days', 'this month', 'recent transactions')
CRITICAL: For queries like 'largest transaction', 'all transactions', 'transaction history' - search the ENTIRE table without ANY date restrictions
CRITICAL: Do NOT assume users want recent data - they want ALL data unless they specifically say otherwise
When user DOES specify time ranges like 'last 30 days', use DATE_SUB with INTERVAL and DAY unit only (not YEAR, MONTH, WEEK)
Use EXTRACT(YEAR FROM created) instead of non-existent YEAR() function
Current timestamp queries should use CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() or CURRENT_DATE()
